attributes.action: Pursue Internet Service Providers To Provide The Broadband Speeds Paid For By Customers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Pursue Internet Service providers to provide the broadband speeds paid for by customers, and do away with 'up to' advertising. If an ISP customer pays £37 for a 20Mbit service he or she ought to receive that service having paid for it and not be throttled during peak periods as Virgin Media has done and continues to do under the cover of its (and other ISP's) 'fair usage' propoganda.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
